optionalfeature.name: Parry
entries: When a creature you can see makes a melee attack against you, you may use a reaction to gain a +2 to your AC until the end of the creature's turn. You must be wielding a simple or martial weapon and a dagger to use this reaction.

optionalfeature.name: Perilous Blows
entries: When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to strike with extra lethality in exchange for opening up your own defense. Doing so means your melee weapon attack rolls during this turn also score a critical hit on a d20 roll of 1 lower than usual (for example on a 19 or 20, rather than just a 20), but attack rolls against you share the same benefit until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Versatile Fighting
entries: While wielding a single versatile weapon and no shield, you can choose to wield your weapon one or two-handed until the start of your next turn. When wielding it one-handed you gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and to your Armor class. Wielding it two-handed you gain a +2 bonus to your damage rolls.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

entries.name: Fast Learners
entries: You gain proficiencies in any two skills, or tools of your choice. (you may also mix and match, eg: 1 skill and 1 tool)

entries.name: Indomitable Human spirit.
entries: Once per long rest, if you are bloodied (Reduced to below half your hit point maximum), you may immediately use your reaction to roll a d12 plus your constitution modifier and gain that many hit points.

entries.name: Versatile
entries: Humans are a varied lot. Choose one of the following options for your character:

items.name: Athletic
items.entry: You gain proficiency in the Athletics skill, and your movement speed increases by 5ft.

items.name: Ingenious
items.entry: You know one {@filter cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list|spells|level=0|class=Wizard}. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for that cantrip (choose when you select this race).

items.name: Martial Prodigy
items.entry: You gain proficiency in light armor, shields, and two simple or martial weapons of your choice.

entries.name: Ancestral Legacy
entries: If you replace a race with this lineage, you can keep the following elements of that race: any skill proficiencies you gained from it and any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it. If you don't keep any of those elements or you choose this lineage at character creation, you gain proficiency in Intimidation and one skill of your choice.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness as shades of gray.

entries.name: Regenerating Form
entries: Your body is laced with regenerative potential, manifesting in the following benefits:
- You gain a +1 bonus to your Armour Class, as your constantly regenerating body is harder to wound.

- Once per long rest, when you start your turn while bloodied, you can push your regeneration to its limits. At the start of each of your turns while this ability is active, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus and can repeat a saving throw against any effect that would allow you to make a saving throw against it at the end of your turn. You cannot heal yourself above half your hit points with this feature. This burst of regenerative energy lasts for one minute or until you are incapacitated.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your fanged maw is a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness as shades of gray.

entries.name: Keen Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

entries.name: Laughing Curse
entries: Your speech is interspersed with cackling laughter. As a bonus action, you may choose to give into the curse, giving you advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks, but disadvantage on Charisma (Persuasion) and Charisma (Performance) for 1 minute.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gnoll.

entries.name: Claws
entries: You have claws that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier slashing damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

entries.name: Hold Breath
entries: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: Your shell provides you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You can't wear light, medium, or heavy armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

entries.name: Aquatic Affinity
entries: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

entries.name: Steam Breath
entries: You have the ability to exhale scalding breath. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 15 foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes 1d10 fire damage. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. Being underwater does not grant resistance to this damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).
You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for your character.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common as well as one additional language of your choice.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light and in darkness as if it were dim light. You discern colors in that darkness only as shades of gray.

entries.name: Armored Casing
entries: You are encased in thin metal or some other durable material. While you aren't wearing armor, your base Armor Class is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Alien Mind
entries: When you are required to make an Intelligence, Wisdom or Charisma saving throw, you can add 1d4 to it. If you choose to do this, it does not stack with other spells or magical resistance effects (this includes bless, magical resistance and resistance).

entries.name: Sentry's Rest
entries: When you take a long rest, you spend at least 6 hours in an inactive, motionless state, instead of sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but you remain conscious.

entries.name: Unique Construction
entries: Opportunity attacks made against you are rolled with disadvantage.

entries.name: Artful Taste
entries: You gain proficiency in Performance.

entries.name: Rampage
entries: When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points on your turn, you may use your bonus action to move up to your movement speed and make a Bite attack against a creature within your reach. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Strong Jaws
entries: Your bite deals 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of 1d4.

entries.name: Tough Hide
entries: Your AC when you arenâ€™t wearing armor is equal to 13 + your Constitution modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.

entries.name: Haunted Magic
entries: You learn a {@filter cantrip of your choice from the Bard spell list.|spells|level=0|class=Bard} Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting modifier for this (choose when you select this subrace). When you reach 3rd level, you can cast a 1st-level spell from the Necromancy or Illusion schools of magic (choose a single spell when you reach this level) with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of 1st level or higher.

entries.name: Cursed Jaws
entries: When you score a critical hit with your Bite or a melee spell attack, you can regain your use of your Haunted Magic 1st-level spell, or regain a first-level spell slot. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all uses when you finish a long rest.
In addition, your Bite is considered to be a melee weapon worth at least 1 gp for the purposes of spell components.

entries.name: Stone Throw
entries: You can draw on the strength of giants and channel it into destructive force. When you take the Attack action on your turn you may replace one of the attacks and hurl a boulder through the air. You throw a mass of earth up to 60 feet to a point you can see. Creatures within a 5 cube centered on that point must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus) or take 1d10 bludgeoning damage. Taking half as much on a success. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).

You must have a hand free to use this trait and you can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. If you have a feature that would make your unarmed attacks magical, this attack becomes magical too.
